DataElement.preferredName: Malignant Neoplasm Other Bone Metastatic Involvement Specify
DataElement.preferredDefinition: a text field to provide an anatomic location where evidence is detected for spread of cancer from a tumor composed of atypical neoplastic cells to additional bones located in another part of the body.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Malignant Neoplasm Other Bone Metastatic Involvement
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to evidence of the spread of cancer from a tumor composed of atypical neoplastic cells to additional bone or bones located in another part of the body.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Not otherwise specified.:A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.  Malignant neoplasms usually metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision.  The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin's lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas. -- 2004

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.

Property.preferredDefinition: Not otherwise specified.:Bone; a rigid connective tissue that makes up the skeleton of vertebrates.:(MET-uh-STAT-ik) Having to do with metastasis, which is the spread of cancer from one part of the body to another.:To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
The structural organ comprised of specialized connective tissue that forms the skeletal components of the body.
A term referring to the clinical or pathologic observation of a tumor extension from its original site of growth to another anatomic site.
To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: revised to provide naming consistency for related elements

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the free text field to specify an anatomic site.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: locations or structures in the human body.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Specify; be specific about something; define clearly.

Concepts.definition: Be specific about something; define clearly.

DataElement.origin: SWOG CRF:Southwest Oncology Group Case Report Form
